Description: Flight into Egypt. Landscape with Joseph leading a donkey carrying Mary and the Christ child, Joseph carries various carpentry tools on his back. 1652 Etching
Curator's comments: The print reproduces a drawing in the National Gallery of Scotland, Edinburgh (see R.-A. d'Hulst, 'Jordaens Drawings', Brussels-London-New York, 1974, p. 341, no. A257, fig. 273). For another impression of this plate see R,2.73. There are seven etchings attributed to Jacob Jordaens (Hollstein 1-3, 5-7 and 9), also described in D'Hulst catalogue (pp.132-136). Although these are all lettered with Jordaens as the designer ('inventor'), they are traditionally considered as also made by him. Lit.: R.-A. D'Hulst, 'Jacob Jordaens (1593-1678), volume II: Drawings and Prints', Koninklijk Museum voor Schone Kunsten, Antwerp, 1993, nos. B93-99.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1)
d'Hulst 1993 / Jacob Jordaens (1593-1678). I: Paintings and Tapestries; II: Drawings and Prints (B93)
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
